result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikolaus W Blank #636247 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentences serving. Concurrent with Bayfield Co. case 22CM9.

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs totaling $550.60. If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant to complete a mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Defendant is to complete an AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations coming from that assessment.

Defendant is to undergo any other counseling or conditions as determined by Department of Corrections. DE to complete moral recognition therapy. Note:  Under Wisconsin State Statute 6.03(1)(b), as a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored.
DE to have no contact with victims or their property.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety, not to possess/consume any alcohol and no consumption of illegal drugs.
To pay any restitution if request.
As a convicted felon, prohibited from possessing a firearm.  As convicted felon, prohibited to vote until civil rights restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
